section.title: How to Clean Up Sherpa When a Download or Install of a CSU File Failed

ol.li: If Sherpa has already pushed the images to Glance then you will need to remove all images of the CSU file from Glance.
Remove the cache file of the CSU file in the sherpa_cache Swift container or in /var/cache/sherpa. This step is optional since the subsequent download will overwrite the old Sherpa cache.
Check the job status of the CSU file using the steps above. If the status is 0 or 1, change it to 3.

section.title: How to Recover a Download Failure
section.p: If there is a broken network connection in the middle of a download, Sherpa will retry. If Sherpa cannot automatically recover the failure then you should follow the steps above to clean up the failed download and retry once the network connection is restored.

section.title: How to Set http_proxy in Sherpa
section.p: If the HPE Helion OpenStack environment is behind a firewall, you need to set the Sherpa proxy shell variables so that the Sherpa service can communicate out to the Helion Download Network (HDN).
On each of your controller nodes, perform these steps to set the proxies:

ol.li: Edit the sherpa.conf file on each controller node in the following location: /etc/sherpa/sherpa.conf
Verify that the http_proxy and https_proxy is set appropriately for your environment. http_proxy=http://myproxy.example.com https_proxy=https://myproxy.example.com
After editing the file, restart the Apache service: sudo service apache2 restart
